Package game

Class GameBoard

java.lang.Object
game.GameBoard
public class GameBoard extends Object
This is the main class for representing and playing the Dots And Boxes game. It is called on by DotsAndBoxes and it uses the following classes:
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • GameBoard

      public GameBoard(int rows, int columns)
      Create the game board. The red player goes first.
      Parameters:
      rows - number of rows
      columns - number of columns

  • Method Details

    • gameOver

      public boolean gameOver()
      Is the game over? This happens when the number of lines claimed equals the number of moves made.
      Returns:
      whether the game is over, man!

    • whoseTurn

      public Player whoseTurn()
      Whose turn is it anyway?
      Returns:
      the player who has the current turn

    • isLineValid

      public boolean isLineValid(int row1, int column1, int row2, int column2)
      Are the coordinates for this line valid or not? To be valid it must be a line that exists and is unclaimed.
      Parameters:
      row1 - first row
      column1 - first column
      row2 - second row
      column2 - second column
      Returns:
      whether the line is valid or not

    • makeMove

      public void makeMove(int row1, int column1, int row2, int column2)
      Make a move in the game given a valid line to claim. A move is made by specifying an unclaimed line to be owned by the current player. If the move claims a box, that player gets to go again, otherwise the next turn is swapped to the other player.
      Parameters:
      row1 - first row
      column1 - first column
      row2 - second row
      column2 - second column

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Return a string representation of the board, e.g. a 2x3 board: 
         0 1 2 3
 0 .-. . .
   |R|   |
 1 .-.-.-.
   |B|
 2 ._._. .
 
 Turn: {PLAYER}, Red: #, Blue: # , Moves: #
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the string
